intro: Hieracium insertum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late spring to early summer, forming a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium insertum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
